New Records: Daryl Mitchell hit the fastest fifty for New Zealand in 26 balls against India in T20Is.
Arshdeep Singh conceded 51 runs in the final over, which was his second most runs conceded in ODIs and fourth most against New Zealand in T20Is.
Key Match Events: New Zealand's 21-run victory was their fourth smallest win in terms of runs against India in T20Is.
Devon Conway and Glenn Phillips set up the third highest third-wicket partnership for New Zealand against India in T20Is.
Post-Match Reflections: Daryl Mitchell was named Player of the Match for his unbeaten 59 runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand's 176 was their seventh highest score against India in T20Is and third highest on Indian soil in T20Is.
India's 155 was their second lowest score in a completed innings against New Zealand at their home venue in T20Is.
